``{r include=FALSE}
#read in sample demographics and clinical measures
glucest <- read.csv("/project/bbl_projects/MotorGluCEST/sandbox/GLUCEST-Clinical-Demographics-Measures-N45.csv", header=TRUE) #csv created by Prepare_Demographics_ClinicalMeasures_Data.Rmd
```
glucest <- subset(glucest, sex=="m" & age > 25,
select=weight:income)

```{r include=FALSE}
#Read in GluCEST % Contrast Measures, GM Density Measures, and Motor Network Coverage Measures
#list all .csv files in root directory
#files <- list.files(path="/Users/roalflab/Documents/MotorGluCEST/OutputMeasures", pattern='.csv', ignore.case=T, full.names = F) 
files <- list.files(path="/project/bbl_projects/MotorGluCEST/sandbox/output_measures/", pattern='.tsv', ignore.case=T, full.names = F) 
filenames <- c()
#generate variable names to assign file data to 
for(name in files){
  #remove "-Measures.tsv"" from end of filename
  Rname <- gsub('.{13}$', '', name)
  #replace - with _ for R compatibility 
  Rname <- chartr(old = "-", new = "_", Rname) 
  #save filenames into a character vector 
  filenames <- append(filenames, Rname) 
}
#read in files and assign to variables
for(i in 1:12){
  #save filename as an individual string
  Rfilename <- sprintf("%s",filenames[i]) 
  #read in csv data for each file
  x <- read.delim(files[i], header=TRUE, sep='\t') 
  #assign csv data to Rfilename string 
  assign(Rfilename, x) 
}
rm(x)
```

# Motor Network GluCEST v. Non-Motor GluCEST and RR 

**Multiple Linear Regression**
```{r}
#Temporary fix!!! 
glucest[ !(glucest$bblid %in% c("125073","132179")),]
#linear regression with age, sex, Motor Network GluCEST and Non-Motor GluCEST predicting BAS RR
summary(lm(glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore ~ GluCEST_ho_MotorNetwork$MotorNetwork_CEST_mean + GluCEST_ho_NonMotor$NonMotor_CEST_mean + glucest$age_scan + glucest$sex))
```

**Motor Network Partial R**
#Need to figure out where GluCEST_ho_NonMotor and GluCEST_ho_MotorNetwork are generated
```{r}
covariates <- data.frame(GluCEST_ho_NonMotor$NonMotor_CEST_mean, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex)
pcor.test(glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore, GluCEST_ho_MotorNetwork$MotorNetwork_CEST_mean, covariates)$estimate
```

**Non-Motor Network Partial R**
```{r}
covariates <- data.frame(GluCEST_ho_MotorNetwork$MotorNetwork_CEST_mean, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex)
pcor.test(glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore, GluCEST_ho_NonMotor$NonMotor_CEST_mean, covariates)$estimate
```

**Motor Network Association Plot (Figure 2)**
```{r echo=TRUE}
plotdata <- data.frame(glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore, GluCEST_ho_MotorNetwork$MotorNetwork_CEST_mean, )
jpeg("/project/bbl_projects/MotorGluCEST/sandbox/Figures/Images/BASRR_MotorNetworkTotal_CorrelationPlot_ColoredbyGroup.jpg", units="in", width=7.3, height=6.6, res=800)
BASRR_MotorNetworkTotal_CorrelationPlot <- ggplot(plotdata, aes(x=glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore, y=GluCEST_ho_MotorNetwork.MotorNetwork_CEST_mean, fill=as.factor(glucest$Diagnosis_NC_MDD_Psy_Coded))) +
  geom_point(color = "black", shape=21, size=3) +
  labs(x="\nBAS Motor Responsiveness Score\n", y="\nGluCEST % Contrast\n") +

  theme(legend.title=element_blank()) +

  scale_fill_manual(values=c(rgb(116,3,5,maxColorValue=255,alpha=255),
                             rgb(239,162,164,maxColorValue=255, alpha=255),
                             rgb(196,36,40,maxColorValue=255, alpha=255)),
                             labels=c("TD","DEP","PSY")) +
  theme(
    axis.title.x=element_text(family="Arial", vjust=0.5, size=17),
    axis.title.y=element_text(family="Arial",  size=17),
    axis.line = element_line(colour = "black"),
    axis.text=element_text(family="Arial",size=18),
    panel.background=element_blank(),
    axis.text.x = element_text(color="black"),
    axis.text.y = element_text(color="black"),
    legend.title=element_blank(), 
    legend.text=element_text(size=14, family="Arial"),
    legend.key = element_rect(fill = NA, colour = NA),
    legend.position="top", 
    legend.justification="left",
    legend.direction="horizontal")
    ggsave("BASRR_MotorNetworkTotal_CorrelationPlot.jpg")
```

**Motor Network GluCEST Between Typically Developing and Clinical Groups**
```{r}
summary(aov(GluCEST_ho_MotorNetwork$MotorNetwork_CEST_mean ~ glucest$age_scan + glucest$sex + as.factor(glucest$Control_Coded)))
```

**Motor Network GluCEST and RR Association in Males v. Females (Interaction Effect for Sex)**
```{r}
#linear regression between GluCEST and RR controlling for age and including an interaction effect for sex
data <- data.frame(glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex, GluCEST_ho_MotorNetwork$MotorNetwork_CEST_mean)
data$glucest.sex <- as.factor(data$glucest.sex)
contrasts(data$glucest.sex) <- c(-.5,.5)
summary(lm(glucest.BAS_Reward_totalscore ~ (GluCEST_ho_MotorNetwork.MotorNetwork_CEST_mean)*(glucest.sex) + glucest.age_scan, data=data))
```

# Adjustment for Medication

```{r}
medications <- read.csv("../Medications/GluCEST_Medications_Timept1_PassQC.csv", header=TRUE) #read in patient medication data
#partial correlation between Motor Network GluCEST and RR controlling for psychotropic medication use (yes/no)
pcor.test(glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore, GluCEST_ho_MotorNetwork$MotorNetwork_CEST_mean, medications$Medication_history)
#partial correlation between Subcortical Motor Network GluCEST and RR controlling for psychotropic medication use (yes/no)
pcor.test(glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore, GluCEST_ho_VisualNetwork$Visual_CEST_mean, medications$Medication_history)
#partial correlation between Salience Motor Network GluCEST and RR controlling for psychotropic medication use (yes/no)
pcor.test(glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore, GluCEST_ho_MotorNetwork_Salience$MotorNetworkC_CEST_mean, medications$Medication_history)
```

# Motor Network by Anatomical Region: Harvard Oxford Region GluCEST and RR 

## Harvard Oxford Motor Network: Cortical Regions

**Filter data for Motor network cortical regions, using > 50 mm^3 as region volume threshold for inclusion in analysis**
```{r echo=FALSE}
#get data for the 7 Harvard Oxford cortical regions reliably present in the GluCEST Motor network, and filter out cases that do not meet the minimum coverage requirement ( > 50 mm^3 for each region)
frontal.pole <- data.frame(GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Frontal_Pole_mean, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Frontal_Pole_numvoxels, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex, glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore)
frontal.pole <- filter(frontal.pole, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor.Frontal_Pole_numvoxels > 10 )
superior.frontal <- data.frame(GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$SFG_mean, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$SFG_numvoxels, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex, glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore)
superior.frontal <- filter(superior.frontal, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor.SFG_numvoxels > 10)
frontal.medial <- data.frame(GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Frontal_Medial_Cortex_mean,  GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Frontal_Medial_Cortex_numvoxels, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex, glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore)
frontal.medial <- filter(frontal.medial, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor.Frontal_Medial_Cortex_numvoxels > 10 )
subcallosal.cortex <- data.frame(GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Subcallosal_Cortex_mean,  GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Subcallosal_Cortex_numvoxels, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex, glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore)
subcallosal.cortex <- filter(subcallosal.cortex, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor.Subcallosal_Cortex_numvoxels > 10 )
paracingulate <- data.frame(GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Paracingulate_Gyrus_mean,  GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Paracingulate_Gyrus_numvoxels, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex, glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore)
paracingulate <- filter(paracingulate, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor.Paracingulate_Gyrus_numvoxels > 10 )
anterior.cingulate <- data.frame(GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Anterior_cingulate_mean, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Anterior_cingulate_numvoxels, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex, glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore)
anterior.cingulate <- filter(anterior.cingulate, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor.Anterior_cingulate_numvoxels > 10 )
posterior.cingulate <- data.frame(GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Posterior_cingulate_mean,  GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor$Posterior_cingulate_numvoxels, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex, glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore)
posterior.cingulate <- filter(posterior.cingulate, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_Cortical_Motor.Posterior_cingulate_numvoxels > 10 )
```

## Harvard Oxford Motor Network: Subcortical Regions

**Filter data for Motor network subcortical regions, using > 50 mm^3 as region volume threshold for inclusion in analysis**

```{r echo=FALSE}
#get data for the 4 Harvard Oxford subcortical regions reliably present in the GluCEST Motor network, and filter out cases that do not meet the minimum coverage requirement ( > 50 mm^3 for each region)
GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor <- GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor %>% mutate(BrainStem.Midbrain_mean = ((((Brain.Stem_mean)*(Brain.Stem_numvoxels)) + ((Unlabeled_voxels_mean)*(Unlabeled_voxels_numvoxels)))/((Brain.Stem_numvoxels)+(Unlabeled_voxels_numvoxels))))
GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor <- GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor %>% mutate(BrainStem.Midbrain_numvoxels = ((Brain.Stem_numvoxels)+(Unlabeled_voxels_numvoxels)))
brainstem.midbrain <- data.frame(GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor$BrainStem.Midbrain_mean,  GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor$BrainStem.Midbrain_numvoxels, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex, glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore )
brainstem.midbrain <- filter(brainstem.midbrain, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor.BrainStem.Midbrain_numvoxels > 10 )
ho-SMA <-  data.frame(GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor$Right_ho-SMA_mean,  GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor$Right_ho-SMA_numvoxels, glucest$age_scan, glucest$sex, glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore)
ho-SMA <- filter(ho-SMA, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor.Right_ho-SMA_numvoxels > 10 )
caudate <-  data.frame(GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor$Right_Caudate_mean,  GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor$Right_Caudate_numvoxels,  glucest$age_scan,glucest$sex, glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore)
caudate <- filter(caudate, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor.Right_Caudate_numvoxels > 10 )
accumbens <-  data.frame(GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor$Right_Accumbens_mean,  GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor$Right_Accumbens_numvoxels, glucest$age_scan,glucest$sex, glucest$BAS_Reward_totalscore)
accumbens <- filter(accumbens, GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor.Right_Accumbens_numvoxels > 10 )
```

**ho-SMA**
```{r echo=FALSE}
covariates <- data.frame(ho-SMA$glucest.sex, ho-SMA$glucest.age_scan)
pcor.test(ho-SMA$GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor.Right_ho-SMA_mean, ho-SMA$glucest.BAS_Reward_totalscore, covariates)
```

**Caudate**
```{r echo=FALSE}
covariates <- data.frame(caudate$glucest.sex, caudate$glucest.age_scan)
pcor.test(caudate$GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor.Right_Caudate_mean, caudate$glucest.BAS_Reward_totalscore, covariates)
```

**Accumbens**
```{r echo=FALSE}
covariates <- data.frame(accumbens$glucest.sex, accumbens$glucest.age_scan)
pcor.test(accumbens$GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor.Right_Accumbens_mean, accumbens$glucest.BAS_Reward_totalscore, covariates)
```

**Brainstem and Midbrain**
```{r echo=FALSE}
covariates <- data.frame(brainstem.midbrain$glucest.sex, brainstem.midbrain$glucest.age_scan)
pcor.test(brainstem.midbrain$GluCEST_HarvardOxford_SubCortical_Motor.BrainStem.Midbrain_mean, brainstem.midbrain$glucest.BAS_Reward_totalscore, covariates)
```

### FDR correction
```{r echo=TRUE}
ps <- c("0.5243663","0.4162064","0.6619631","0.0621055","0.05856767","0.4718429","0.03024202","0.01662653","0.07915414","0.2245098","0.04523888") #p-values from pcor.test
fdr.ps <- p.adjust(ps, method="fdr")
fdr.ps
```
